description:
Households receiving housing allowance

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
22311 Housing allowance on 31 December

Definition:
Housing allowance is a subsidy towards housing costs that is
funded half by the Federation and half by the Länder. It is
paid to low-income households to help them afford the costs
of adequate and family-friendly housing. The details of how
housing allowance is granted are governed by the Housing
Allowance Act (WoGG).

From reference year 1991 to reference year 2000, the
households receiving housing allowance consisted of
households receiving table-based housing allowance and those
receiving lump-sum housing allowance.
From reference year 2001 to reference year 2004, the
households receiving housing allowance consisted of
households receiving general housing allowance and those
receiving special rent support.
Since reference year 2005, the households receiving housing
allowance have consisted of households with all members
being entitled to housing allowance and sub-households of
members entitled to housing allowance.
